greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = Sum_{c in C(n,k)} lcm(c) where C(n,k) is the set of all k-subsets of {1,2,...,n}.
comment: The C(n,k) are also called combinations of n with size k (see A181842).
Main diagonal gives: A003418. Lower diagonal gives: A094308. Column k=1 gives: A000217. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 29 2013
link: Alois P. Heinz, rows n = 0..25, flattened
maple: for k from 0 to n do
seq(seq(T(n, k), k=0..n), n=0..10);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 29 2013
mathematica: t[_, 0] = 1; t[n_, k_] := Sum[LCM @@ c, {c, Subsets[Range[n], {k}]}]; Table[t[n, k], {n, 0, 8}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 29 2013 *)
program: w = b(n-1, k) if k<n else [0]
return w + [lcm(c,n) for c in b(n-1, k-1)]
def T(n, k): return add(b(n, k))
flatten([[T(n, k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..10)])
xref: Row sums give A226037. Cf. A096179, A181854.
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, Dec 06 2010
